doc.repnme: Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA) annual report 2008
doc.abstracts: During fiscal year 2008, the Bank Group committed 38.2 billion dollars in loans, grants, equity investments and guarantees to its members and to private businesses in member countries, an increase of 3.9 billion dolalrs (11.4 percent) from fiscal year 2007. The World Bank, comprising International Development Association (IDA) and International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), committed 24.7 billion dollars in loans and grants to its member countries. IDA commitments to the world's poorest countries were 11.2 billion dollars, five percent lower than the previous year. IBRD commitments in fiscal 2008 totaled 13.5 billion dollars, five percent higher than the previous year. International Finance Corporation (IFC) committed 11.4 billion dollars and mobilized an additional 4.8 billion dollars for private sector investments in developing countries, more than 40 percent of which were in IDA eligible countries. Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA) issued close to 2.1 billion dollars in guarantees in support of investments in the developing world, an increase of 730 million dollars over 2007. Of the total, 689.6 million dollars went to IDA-eligible countries. This year, MIGA's operating income was 55 million dollars, compared with 49 million dollars in FY07. The increase of 6 million dollars was due to an increase in net premium income and investment income and a decrease in the agency's administrative expenses. FY08 net income increased by 3.4 million dollars compared to FY07, primarily due to higher guarantee income and investment income and translation gains.
